You are here:
GitLab releases
GitLab has been releasing every month for the last 166 months straight!

Patch releases
Based on the
GitLab Maintenance Policy
, patch releases include bug fixes for the current stable released version of
GitLab and security fixes for the two previous monthly releases in addition to the current stable release.
The cadence of patch releases is twice a month on the Wednesdays before and after the monthly release week.
These are best-effort dates and they might be subject to change.
GitLab Maintained Versions
The
GitLab Maintenance Policy
maintains the current stable release and the previous two monthly releases.
Refer to
currently maintained versions
.
More information
There are a number of ways you can find out about the latest releases and their features:
Go to the
GitLab project releases page
to learn about recent features in our official GitLab releases.
Visit the
releases blog
to view release posts, including patch release posts.
Use the
What's new feature
while you're using GitLab to discover new features.
Go to the
GitLab.com release page
for information about the features and current release on
GitLab.com
.
Check the changelogs:
GitLab Community Edition
GitLab Enterprise Edition
GitLab Runner
Compare the feature changes between two different releases by using the
Release Feature & Deprecation Overview page
. Due to the large number of improvements in each release, you can export the information to CSV.
GitLab Quarterly Launch
.
Release Blog Archives
- Access all previous GitLab release posts, organized by version number and date.
To learn how to update your self-managed instance so you can take advantage of new features, see the
update documentation
.
Changes prior to GitLab 8.0 are available
in the archive
.
Find out what we're planning to release in future by:
Viewing the most important features of upcoming releases on the
upcoming releases page
.
Viewing
upcoming features by product tier
.
To learn more about how our releases work, see the
monthly release template
in the
release tools repository
.
